snippet: Instead of tasting like something yanked from the blades of a lawn mower, sunflower shoots carry a faintly almond-ish trace.
abstract: Many cooks tend to see sunflower shoots as a secret salad weapon, providing an extra element of texture and color; shoots are best eaten when they are newly sprouted and have just two supple leaves.
lead_paragraph: Instead of tasting like something yanked from the blades of a lawn mower, sunflower shoots carry a faintly almond-ish trace.

headline.seo: Sunflower Shoots Are a Salad’s Secret Weapon
headline.main: A Salad’s Surprise Shot of Flavor
headline.print_headline: A Salad’s Surprise Shot Of Flavor
